title: Routes optimizations
text:
• Scheduling new appointments with route optimization in mind.
  • Minimizing the length of a route given multiple appointments.


(Python, Flask, Leaflet, Google Maps and Agenda API)

more.text:
This software is intended for my previous employer Prop Lavage, but the project was developed with modularity in mind in order to accomodate other potential companies.

The backend is almost done, this frontend is a temporary minimalist implementation.

title: Internship at Coyote Amérique
text:
A tool intended for developers that lives as a microservice among others and shows events flowing in gRPC and Kafka pipelines. Its web app let's users filter events in various ways. Coyote offers a service rivalizing with Waze and Google Maps.

(Go, Vue.js, Docker)

more.text: This project is the fruit of an internship with the R&D team of Coyote Amérique. During this summer, I learned immensely and am grateful for the brilliant and generous colleagues who supported me. Later, I was happy to discover that developers from various divisions were still benefiting from my work.

title: Snake Game
text:
Simple game featuring a bot that uses the Dijkstra algorithm implemented in O(n). When the apple is not in reach, the X represents the most hopeful escape. The snake should zig-zag without blocking it. In progress.

(C++)

title: Web Scraper
text:
Automatically shops on the web, looking for products with specific characteristics under a price threshold. It updates a sheets document and notifies me.

(Python, Selenium, Google APIs)

title: Transactions parser
text:
Automated personal finance analysis. The user inputs bank statements, and transactions are graphically expressed by category.

(Python, Tesseract-OCR, Google Sheets API)

title: Web Game
text:
A game intended for movie buffs who want to challenge their knowledge of their favorite movies.

(Python, Flask, ffmpeg, Cloudinary API, html, js)

title: Minishell
text:
A shell that immitates bash. It supports pipes, redirections, wildcards, tab completion and more! Developed as part of my studies at 42 with a colleague.

(C)

title: Map projection
text:
A program that displays an isometric wireframe map. Slopes can be exaggerated, the map can be rotated with 90 degrees increments.

(C)

title: FLahk
text:
Sits on top and improves FL Studio by speeding up the workflow and putting the user in unforseen situations, fostering creativity. This project is the combination of my passion for music, programming and experimentation.

(AutoHotKey, Python, ffmpeg)

title: Philosophers
text:
An exercise completed as part of my studies at 42 where N threads must share ressources fairly with high precision. I worked with threads, mutexes, forks and semaphores.

(C)

title: ft_irc
text:
A chat server that follows the IRC protocol. Compatible with any IRC client. Our tester simulates intense stress and was essential to ensure robustness. Implemented with two colleagues.

(C++)
